internal.content:
---
title: Users
---           
 
## Migrated Users
- Users will be migrated to MAS from the existing Maximo (7612+) during the upgrade.

![image](images/users.png)   

- Users are created with `Set in Manage` access. The user access is managed in the Manage application using [security groups](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/maximo-manage/8.0.0?topic=management-configuring-security-groups) as before.

![image](images/usercreated.png)   

- If SMTP is configured, all the migrated users will receive two emails.
  - Welcome to IBM Maximo Application Suite.
  - Your IBM Application Suite Password.
- Password can be replaced from Users page (in edit mode) using Replace forgotten password link.
- A maxadmin user is created by default with a password as maxadminmaxadmin#1.
- User authorization(application access) is done in Manage application using Security groups as before.

Sample Emails

![image](images/email.png)  

## Entitlement
- Entitlement in MAS can set as
  - Premium (15 app points)
  - Base (10 app points)
  - Limited (5 app points)
  - Self Service (0 app point)
  - Entiitlement calculation details: [MAS licensing Model](apppoints)
  
## Troubleshooting
  - Check the database log. Fix any errors.
  - If the users are not migrated to MAS:
    - Login to MAS admin UI using admin credentials.
      - If maxadmin user is not created then
        - Create `maxadmin` user in MAS from the users page.
    - Login to MAS as `maxadmin`.
    - Go to the Manage app, check the user sync cron task (MASUSERSYNC) from the Cron Task application. 
       - Create a new cron task instance and run the cron task again.

MdxNode.rawBody:
---
title: Users
---           
 
## Migrated Users
- Users will be migrated to MAS from the existing Maximo (7612+) during the upgrade.

![image](images/users.png)   

- Users are created with `Set in Manage` access. The user access is managed in the Manage application using [security groups](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/maximo-manage/8.0.0?topic=management-configuring-security-groups) as before.

![image](images/usercreated.png)   

- If SMTP is configured, all the migrated users will receive two emails.
  - Welcome to IBM Maximo Application Suite.
  - Your IBM Application Suite Password.
- Password can be replaced from Users page (in edit mode) using Replace forgotten password link.
- A maxadmin user is created by default with a password as maxadminmaxadmin#1.
- User authorization(application access) is done in Manage application using Security groups as before.

Sample Emails

![image](images/email.png)  

## Entitlement
- Entitlement in MAS can set as
  - Premium (15 app points)
  - Base (10 app points)
  - Limited (5 app points)
  - Self Service (0 app point)
  - Entiitlement calculation details: [MAS licensing Model](apppoints)
  
## Troubleshooting
  - Check the database log. Fix any errors.
  - If the users are not migrated to MAS:
    - Login to MAS admin UI using admin credentials.
      - If maxadmin user is not created then
        - Create `maxadmin` user in MAS from the users page.
    - Login to MAS as `maxadmin`.
    - Go to the Manage app, check the user sync cron task (MASUSERSYNC) from the Cron Task application. 
       - Create a new cron task instance and run the cron task again.
